Articles.Content:
KR-71 Whitebird (SR-71 Blackbird Replica) by Turboshield

About as close as I could get to the real thing, while it has a ridiculous ceiling, it requires sensible flying, you can't just jam the w/s key and expect everything to be fine. A bit heavy on the part count, and it has a few support struts holding it together, I may post a more refined version in the future.

Specifications:

Cruising Altitude: 30,000-32,000m

Max Cruising Altitude:38,000m

Max Cruising Speed:2,080-2,320m/s

Maximum Speed:2,480m/s

Capable of sub-orbital hops with an apoapsis averaging 136km.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Enjoy!

KR-71 Whitebird - https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/s/hfsoioy22lf2teg/KR-71%20WhiteBird.craft?token_hash=AAE-w1giM_Pmw96b9TAr4FwxSU59QsGxxlVe7qeY7ZDW5A&dl=1

KR-71 Whitebird Long Range Version - https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/s/07o6fhp491bw0my/KR-71%20WhiteBird%20-%20Long%20Range.craft?token_hash=AAFLMsmETZ-wVVPBm3XbQiF8iUuJVu7_nl27FFKk_zd4VA&dl=1

-Turbosheild

Edited October 13, 2013 by Turbosheild
pics are back up, link to the pics was broken.
Now with pictures that you can actually see!
Pics make it difficult to actually see it. However, it looks as though you got the shape right.

Ooh, pretty fire. I want to tou--OW, FIRE HOT! HOT FIRE. FIRE BAD.

Well done, may I suggest clipping the turbojets inside of each other instead of mounting them horizontally?
I had have them side-by-side due to how I attached the air intakes to each other, was the only was to do it for how I set up the nacelles.
Nice build! Amazing how you were able to make it preform similarly to the real thing, nice engine nacelles.
